column4: (this is probably a dumb question, but that can't be helped.) i have just set up an ubuntu LAMP server. if critical patches for apache2 etc comes out, will my box be automatically patched? if not, what do i need to do to accomplish this?
critical patches will be offered to you from the gutsy-security repo, make sure that it's enabled in the updates tab of system->admin->software sources
thanks, but i only have ssh access. how do check that this is enabled (and if it isn'
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list , remove the # from any line with gutsy-security in it

just a final question to make sure i get this important part right: merely uncommenting that line will make sure patches are automatically installed once they are released? i don't have to run some update command with cron or somesuch?

the default is offering, but you'd have to manually install the updates. You can change that to automatically updating apache2 from the security repo by editing /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
um, I'm not sure if the server runs a regular check for updates automatically though.
i don't have any 50unattended-upgrades file in that directory. i have 01autoremove, 01ubuntu, 05aptitude, and 70debconf
what would be the command to check for updates, then? so i can put it as a cron job
there's a package called unattended-upgrades (just found it) that's what you want
i just installed it via aptitude. no idea if it works, but thanks. indeed it seems to be what i want
if you look at that 50unattended-upgrades it will show you what's being done.  /usr/share/doc/apt/examples/configure-index.gz  has the full options
configure-index is empty and 50unattended-upgrades tell me nothing about how often this is run. is there any other way i can see this?
I'm not real good at reading python but I *think* you need to add /usr/bin/unattended-upgrade to a cron. beware of this advice, check it out
ok, thanks. for some reason there is very scant information on unattended-upgrade on the net.
not suprised really. I'd look on wiki.ubuntu.com for info, and in the bugs.launchpad.net database for inferential info
thanks. from just running /usr/bin/unattended-upgrade it doesn't seem like there's too many options you can give it. i think i'll stick it in a cron file and hope for the best.
